page.title: 02Introduction to Yarlet Area
page.content: Wildlife is limited to hedges and woodland, as all the land in our area is farmland. There ar many rabbits, hares, a few badgers, grey squirrals and foxes. Common birds include magpies, rooks, pied wagtails, swallows and chaffinches. As the villages are small, there are few amenities: there is one shop, one pub, two garages, a few scattered post boxes and phone boxes. Thre is no state school, so children have to go to Stone or Stafford. The only bus routes are on the A34 and A5013. People living in the area thus make their own entertainment in their homes, gardens or in the surrounding countryside,watching television, growing vegetables or perhaps riding. There have been few changes in the last 25 years except for increased
